Description.val: Tactical trailers and dolly sets are used to transport generators, shelters, drinking water, ammunition, and general cargo.  This budget line funds the Light Engineer Utility Trailer (LEUT).  The prime movers for these trailers range from the High Mobility Multi-Purpose Wheeled Vehicle (HMMWV) to the 10-Ton M977 Series Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck (HEMTT).  The Light Engineer Utility Trailer (LEUT) is a pintle towed light utility trailer.  The LEUT will be used across the full spectrum of military operations to include deployments and to support nation-building operations.  The LEUT will transport key construction and mine clearing enablers such as Skid Steer Loaders (SSL), Backhoe Loaders (BHL) and M160 Robotic Mine Flail.  Two types of LEUTs are required.  Type I LEUT is a 5-ton payload capacity trailer which must be Low Velocity Air Drop (LVAD) capable.  Type II LEUT is a 12-ton payload capacity trailer.  The prime movers for the Type I and Type II LEUT are the HEMTT, 2.5 ton cargo, 5-ton cargo, and 5, 10, and 20-ton dump trucks.  The Army Acquisition Objective for the LEUT is 2,563 (Type I: 1,359 and Type II: 1,204).

Justification.val:
FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $16.512 million supports the procurement of 220 Type I LEUTs and 191 Type II LEUTs to include manuals, transportation, and fielding.  Acquisition Strategy includes test articles and Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) quantities for Type I and Type II trailers.  The LEUT will provide engineer units with a critically needed dedicated small equipment transport capability.  With the LEUT's ability to transport key construction enablers, the LEUT will allow future force units the ability to gain, control and sustain route access in a timely manner and effectively maintain momentum/mobility throughout the battlespace.  

Prior Year Total Obligation Authority is incorrect. Correct amount should be $10.318M, quantity of 13.

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val:
PM/Matrix Support includes PM and System Engineering oversight required to manage the program and provide contractor oversight. Salaries, Benefits, Travel, Personnel Training and other government costs are included for retaining a professional acquisition workforce.

There is a 3-6 month gap between production of test assets and contract award for FY18 and FY19 funding. The gap is due to First Article Test followed by validation/verification.

OverallDeliveryScheduleRemarks.val: There is a 3-6 month gap between production of test assets and contract award for FY18 and FY19 funding. The gap is due to First Article Test followed by validation/verification.
